adjectives.description: matronly (comparative more matronly, superlative most matronly)

entries.meaning: In the capacity of a matron; serving as a housekeeper or head nurse.
examples: The matronly woman cared for the sick orphan.

entries.meaning: Exuding the authority, wisdom, power, and intelligence of an experienced woman.
examples: ...the matronly upper arms girls know about life and love and losing... Janeane Garofalo

entries.meaning: Having the appearance of a mature woman, often of larger physical stature and somewhat unkempt or dowdy.
examples: Gone is her matronly gray frizzy hair and those bushy brows, frumpy frock and old lady pearls. [1]

adverbs.description: matronly (comparative more matronly, superlative most matronly)

entries.meaning: In the manner of a matron.
